subject: Re: [junit] Basic Doubt
msgSnippet: ... It s not. Is it required to have a test suite method? No, but your code should work fine, just remove the call to testAdd() in your setUp() method, JUnit
messageBody:
On 6/27/06, strutsquery <strutsquery@...> wrote:

> Why is the Manager object required to be instantiated inside the
> setUp method?


It's not.


Is it required to have a test suite method?


No, but your code should work fine, just remove the call to testAdd() in
your setUp() method, JUnit will invoke testAdd() on its own.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
